title: 777cartel
author: 777cartel
content: First, this is my first post on this forum, after going through the rules guiding our conduct in this forum I have decided to make an official thread to acknowledge my presence here.Back to the title of the thread: bitcoin can save a life where ever you are as long as you have it in your wallet, I was in the hospital recently and I witnessed a situation that motivated me to make such a statement, I saw a hart condition patients who was booked for an X-ray scan but hard his bank account freeze because the account was used to raise money to support the medical bills and he has to go to the law enforcement officers to clarify that but because of the health condition that is not possible as he needed urgent medical attention, all thanks to his supportive friend who did fundraising once again but this time choose to use Bitcoin and this choice becomes a lifesaver the funds was sorted seamlessly and everything went through without restriction and the guy got the medical attention needed.AM HAPPY TO BE PART OF THIS GREAT BITCOIN COMMUNITY

comments.author: Despairo
comments.body: I feel this story is too bizare.The patients need an urgent medical treatment and his account got blocked by banks that supposed to pay the medical bills, if I were in this positions (his friends) I would use my personal money and ask the other friends to raise more money. Okay let's say his friends make a donation via Bitcoin, do you think the fundraising can be completed in just a day? I don't think so, it's need a time and you said it's an urgent moment. Now I don't understand the part why the patient's bank account can be frozen, but the another bank account used to receive Bitcoin sources doesn't get banned. Bank is more strict about Bitcoin activities rather than normal fiat activities.

comments.author: decodx
comments.body: Yes, it is an unusual and bizarre example that I do not believe many people can relate to. Despite this, however, one fact is true: unlike your bank account, crypto funds cannot be frozen or seized if they are kept in a private wallet, and no one else has access to your private keys. If you hold crypto, no one, not even the police or any government agency, can freeze your assets.

comments.author: CryptoHeadlineNews
comments.body: Where fiat currency stops, Bitcoin continues.It's very impressive to have known Bitcoin saved this guy's life, and kudos to his friends for the massive support.But actually, I will like to throw more light on how the banking system operates, because just as you know, we have got both "CURRENT" & "SAVINGS" accounts, whereas most savings accounts are restricted to a certain amount of money, whereby if money above the limit enters the account, it will be blocked till the account user comes for an upgrade, which I think was what happened to the money fundraised into the bank account. Which due to this ill health, couldnt get it fixed, unlike Bitcoin which is beyond control by a central authority

Reserved sensitive information multiple place.  (Not online)I share just some most repeated information, finally if can safely management everything so Bitcoin is most of help on your life for the safe transaction.

comments.author: Bhig Daddy
comments.body: Your line of "bitcoin can save your life wherever you are" but this your story doesn't sound convincing enough, it look like a made up story, but the fact that bitcoin can save you wherever you are is absolutely true.

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: As with others, I don't like to doubt your story. Although it's fake but true. A centralized bank would freeze an account at any time if funds come from different suspectable sources. But for Bitcoin never mind wherever you are, you can receive money at any time. No one will ask you ever but should use your non-custodial wallet. That's another fact about receiving Bitcoin. If the story is really true, then thanks for sharing the story, at least Bitcoin saved a life.

comments.author: Rengga Jati
comments.body: Aside from whether the story is true or fake, there are some notes:1. This statement will only realize in a country in which Bitcoin is legal for payment methods. And I wonder in what country do you live that a hospital accepts Bitcoin as payment? 2. This seems like a global problem that someone should pay at first the money for the hospital before getting treatment. 3. If this story is true, it is good enough if Bitcoin can be more global, many more people can accept this as payment. For, in my country, this story will never happen because TC is not legal as a payment method. 4. This story may be true and happen in the future due to the global progress and development of Bitcoin acceptance in each country. And yes excatlyBitcoin will really help us.

comments.author: sheenshane
comments.body: There's a heavy reason why your friend's bank account freeze maybe because of these; (if your story is true)Linked with suspicious or illegal activities such as Money laundering or terrorist funding.Can freeze for unpaid taxesUnpaid debt to any government servicesBut I've got your point here, be your own bank and yes, Bitcoin is a great opportunity where you have a full control with your fund but there are some minors consequences that you must to consider.  I don't think your friend will still think to spend his Bitcoin even if we're in the price correction stage which we saw the price of Bitcoin dropped too much.  That's the disadvantage of Bitcoin, the value of the dollar is vulnerable if you convert it into cash.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: It may be a great story that has a good and happy ending, but it does not justify the title. That Bitcoin can save your life wherever you are is an overstatement. Bitcoin cannot save your life wherever you are. That's simply an exaggeration. I think it is well accepted even by the Bitcoin community itself that Bitcoin is not widely accepted as a currency and that you can hardly live a life with Bitcoin as your preferred money.

Maybe your country accepted bitcoin for payments and it's nice to hear that bitcoins save life and for sure if could it happen that all countries accept Bitcoin for payment maybe many life will save.

comments.body: The message is the central focus for me. Yes bitcoin can't be frozen on a Dapp. One thing with centralized system of financial storage is that it comes with lots of procedures and the strongly hold to it not minding if lives are at risk or endangered. Resolving to using decentralized means of transaction for bulky needs in cases of urgency is somehow the best maybe the process of frozen account and limitations of fund access will be reduced

comments.author: witcher_sense
comments.body: Quote from: 777cartel on May 10, 2022, 01:28:09 PMFirst, this is my first post on this forum, after going through the rules guiding our conduct in this forum I have decided to make an official thread to acknowledge my presence here.Back to the title of the thread: bitcoin can save a life where ever you are as long as you have it in your wallet, I was in the hospital recently and I witnessed a situation that motivated me to make such a statement, I saw a hart condition patients who was booked for an X-ray scan but hard his bank account freeze because the account was used to raise money to support the medical bills and he has to go to the law enforcement officers to clarify that but because of the health condition that is not possible as he needed urgent medical attention, all thanks to his supportive friend who did fundraising once again but this time choose to use Bitcoin and this choice becomes a lifesaver the funds was sorted seamlessly and everything went through without restriction and the guy got the medical attention needed.AM HAPPY TO BE PART OF THIS GREAT BITCOIN COMMUNITY If health care institutions such as hospitals were to accept cash, the problem that you described would never have taken place. Considering the fact that we are rapidly moving toward becoming a cashless society based on CBDCs, unpleasant situations like this will occur more and more often. People won't be able to transfer money without a bank's permission: therefore, it is banks that will decide what you can spend "your" money on. In particular, you can be denied medical treatment because of your misbehavior, disobedience, misdeeds, wrongthink, or not supporting the current narrative; in short, you will be punished or even doomed to die just because banks consider some of your actions "wrong." Can bitcoin "fix" this? If you find a "canceled-like-you" doctor who would accept bitcoin for their services, then you probably will get your desirable treatment, but it unlikely will be of the same quality as you would have gotten in hospitals that play by the rules imposed by banks.

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: Quote from: 777cartel on May 10, 2022, 01:28:09 PMFirst, this is my first post on this forum, after going through the rules guiding our conduct in this forum I have decided to make an official thread to acknowledge my presence here.Welcome to the forum but making a thread to show your presence is unnecessary. It is better to say you make this thread because you want to discuss your thinking about Bitcoin and its advantage as you wrote below.Back to the title of the thread: bitcoin can save a life where ever you are as long as you have it in your walletQuoteI was in the hospital recently and I witnessed a situation that motivated me to make such a statement, I saw a hart condition patients who was booked for an X-ray scan but hard his bank account freeze because the account was used to raise money to support the medical bills and he has to go to the law enforcement officers to clarify thatA freeze on bank account is not related to his medical bill as I guess. Probably his account was frozen before he went to hospital for whatever reasons.From this story, you can say "Not your keys, not your coins". Even if you have Bitcoin, but you buy and store it on centralized exchanges with custodial wallet, it is not actually your coin.Why?Because centralized exchanges can free your account (same as bank can do) and you might (or might) not successfully to get your account back.To be safe, you must use non custodial wallet to store your coin.

comments.author: sunsilk
comments.body: The same goes for bitcoins that are stored on exchanges.There's a possibility that your funds might be frozen by that exchange depending on the activity that you're doing inside their platform. If you're clean and do nothing, that's good. But knowing that exchange behaviors are changing from time to time, just remember that you don't hold your private keys if they're stored there so it all ends up with the idea, that you don't own your bitcoins there even if it is on your account.

Who would be fool enough to use casino as their wallet much the same as use an exchange to store your funds where some of it are non-custodial exchange. Better use your own wallet where you have the keys or seed phrase of the wallet.
